summary: The memorandum from the Central Cover Staff, authored by He. Clark Schor of the Plans and Review Group, serves as a supplementary response to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). It elaborates on the contents of CCS files pertaining to individuals and entities such as George DeMohrenschildt, Leo Cherne, William Harvey, Richard Helms, James Angleton, Raymond Rocca, and the Wackenhut Corporation. These files include contact reports, trace requests, associations, activities, and professional documentation spanning various years, providing detailed insights into their connections and roles during specific periods.
key_findings: CCS files contain detailed information on George DeMohrenschildt, including 1963 contact reports and a trace request.
Leo Cherne's involvement with the Research Institute of America and his role in providing cover for an officer in Paris is documented from 1949 to 1964.
Approximately 50 documents cover William Harvey's Agency career from 1947 to 1967, focusing on cover establishment and maintenance.
Documents on Richard Helms, James Angleton, and Raymond Rocca include TDY travel orders and cover documentation, detailing their professional engagements.
The Wackenhut Corporation is referenced in 100 to 150 documents from 1963 to 1977, mainly regarding interactions with its officials.
